meanings.definition: To put on a list of people or things that are not approved or accepted.
meanings.sent1: She decided to backlist the unreliable supplier.
meanings.sent2: The company started backlisting vendors with poor quality products.
meanings.sent3: The idea of backlisting the noisy neighbors seemed like a good solution.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, backlisting was akin to creating a shield against unwanted trouble.
meanings.sent5: Backlisting can help maintain order and quality in a community.

meanings.definition: The act of putting someone or something on a list of people or things that are not approved or accepted.
meanings.sent1: The backlisting of certain products caused a stir among customers.
meanings.sent2: Backlisting can sometimes lead to misunderstandings and conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The backlisting of the old library books made the librarian chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, backlisting can be a powerful tool for exclusivity.
meanings.sent5: The backlisting of troublemakers ensured a peaceful event.
